verses.verse: Then the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Go<WH935> in unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, and tell<WH1696> him, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may serve<WH5647> me.
For if thou refuse<WH3986> to let them go<WH7971>, and wilt hold<WH2388> them still,

Behold, the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> is<WH1961> upon thy cattle<WH4735> which is in the field<WH7704>, upon the horses<WH5483>, upon the asses<WH2543>, upon the camels<WH1581>, upon the oxen<WH1241>, and upon the sheep<WH6629>: there shall be a very<WH3966> grievous<WH3515> murrain<WH1698>.

And the LORD<WH3068> shall sever<WH6395> between the cattle<WH4735> of Israel<WH3478> and the cattle<WH4735> of Egypt<WH4714>: and there shall nothing<WH1697> die<WH4191> of all that is the children's<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
And the LORD<WH3068> appointed<WH7760> a set time<WH4150>, saying<WH559>, To morrow<WH4279> the LORD<WH3068> shall do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> in the land<WH776>.

And the LORD<WH3068> did<WH6213> that thing<WH1697> on the morrow<WH4283>, and all the cattle<WH4735> of Egypt<WH4714> died<WH4191>: but of the cattle<WH4735> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> died<WH4191> not one<WH259>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971>, and, behold, there was not one<WH259> of the cattle<WH4735> of the Israelites<WH3478> dead<WH4191>. And the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547> was hardened<WH3513>, and he did not let the people<WH5971> go<WH7971>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872> and unto Aaron<WH175>, Take<WH3947> to you handfuls<WH2651> <WH4393> of ashes<WH6368> of the furnace<WH3536>, and let Moses<WH4872> sprinkle<WH2236> it toward the heaven<WH8064> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And it shall become small dust<WH80> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and shall be a boil<WH7822> breaking forth<WH6524> with blains<WH76> upon man<WH120>, and upon beast<WH929>, throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And they took<WH3947> ashes<WH6368> of the furnace<WH3536>, and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>; and Moses<WH4872> sprinkled<WH2236> it up toward heaven<WH8064>; and it became a boil<WH7822> breaking forth<WH6524> with blains<WH76> upon man<WH120>, and upon beast<WH929>.

And the magicians<WH2748> could<WH3201> not stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> Moses<WH4872> because<WH6440> of the boils<WH7822>; for the boil<WH7822> was upon the magicians<WH2748>, and upon all the Egyptians<WH4714>.
And the LORD<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and he hearkened<WH8085> not unto them; as the LORD<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Rise up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and stand<WH3320> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>, and say<WH559> unto him, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may serve<WH5647> me.

For I will at this time<WH6471> send<WH7971> all my plagues<WH4046> upon thine heart<WH3820>, and upon thy servants<WH5650>, and upon thy people<WH5971>; that thou mayest know<WH3045> that there is none like me in all the earth<WH776>.
For now I will stretch out<WH7971> my hand<WH3027>, that I may smite<WH5221> thee and thy people<WH5971> with pestilence<WH1698>; and thou shalt be cut off<WH3582> from the earth<WH776>.

And in very<WH199> deed<WH5668> for this cause have I raised thee up<WH5975>, for to shew<WH7200> in thee my power<WH3581>; and that my name<WH8034> may be declared<WH5608> throughout all the earth<WH776>. raised: Heb. made thee stand
As yet exaltest<WH5549> thou thyself against my people<WH5971>, that thou wilt not let them go<WH7971>?

Behold, to morrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> I will cause it to rain<WH4305> a very<WH3966> grievous<WH3515> hail<WH1259>, such as hath not been<WH3644> in Egypt<WH4714> since<WH4480> the foundation<WH3117> <WH3245> thereof even until now.

Send<WH7971> therefore now, and gather<WH5756> thy cattle<WH4735>, and all that thou hast in the field<WH7704>; for upon every man<WH120> and beast<WH929> which shall be found<WH4672> in the field<WH7704>, and shall not be brought<WH622> home<WH1004>, the hail<WH1259> shall come down<WH3381> upon them, and they shall die<WH4191>.
He that feared<WH3373> the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> among the servants<WH5650> of Pharaoh<WH6547> made his servants<WH5650> and his cattle<WH4735> flee<WH5127> into the houses<WH1004>:
And he that regarded<WH7760> <WH3820> not the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> left<WH5800> his servants<WH5650> and his cattle<WH4735> in the field<WH7704>. regarded: Heb. set not his heart unto

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Stretch forth<WH5186> thine hand<WH3027> toward heaven<WH8064>, that there may be hail<WH1259> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, upon man<WH120>, and upon beast<WH929>, and upon every herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>, throughout the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And Moses<WH4872> stretched forth<WH5186> his rod<WH4294> toward heaven<WH8064>: and the LORD<WH3068> sent<WH5414> thunder<WH6963> and hail<WH1259>, and the fire<WH784> ran along<WH1980> upon the ground<WH776>; and the LORD<WH3068> rained<WH4305> hail<WH1259> upon the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

So there was hail<WH1259>, and fire<WH784> <WH3947> mingled<WH8432> with the hail<WH1259>, very<WH3966> grievous<WH3515>, such as there was none<WH3808> like it in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> since it became a nation<WH1471>.

And the hail<WH1259> smote<WH5221> throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> all that was in the field<WH7704>, both man<WH120> and beast<WH929>; and the hail<WH1259> smote<WH5221> every herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>, and brake<WH7665> every tree<WH6086> of the field<WH7704>.
Only in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>, where the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> were, was there no hail<WH1259>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971>, and called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, and said<WH559> unto them, I have sinned<WH2398> this time<WH6471>: the LORD<WH3068> is righteous<WH6662>, and I and my people<WH5971> are wicked<WH7563>.

Intreat<WH6279> the LORD<WH3068> (for it is enough<WH7227>) that there be no more mighty<WH430> thunderings<WH6963> and hail<WH1259>; and I will let you go<WH7971>, and ye shall stay<WH5975> no longer<WH3254>. mighty: Heb. voices of God

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto him, As soon as I am gone out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892>, I will spread abroad<WH6566> my hands<WH3709> unto the LORD<WH3068>; and the thunder<WH6963> shall cease<WH2308>, neither shall there be any more hail<WH1259>; that thou mayest know<WH3045> how that the earth<WH776> is the LORD'S<WH3068>.
But as for thee and thy servants<WH5650>, I know<WH3045> that ye will not yet fear<WH3372> <WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430>.
And the flax<WH6594> and the barley<WH8184> was smitten<WH5221>: for the barley<WH8184> was in the ear<WH24>, and the flax<WH6594> was bolled<WH1392>.
But the wheat<WH2406> and the rie<WH3698> were not smitten<WH5221>: for they<WH2007> were not grown up<WH648>. not grown: Heb. hidden or, dark

And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892> from Pharaoh<WH6547>, and spread abroad<WH6566> his hands<WH3709> unto the LORD<WH3068>: and the thunders<WH6963> and hail<WH1259> ceased<WH2308>, and the rain<WH4306> was not poured<WH5413> upon the earth<WH776>.

And when Pharaoh<WH6547> saw<WH7200> that the rain<WH4306> and the hail<WH1259> and the thunders<WH6963> were ceased<WH2308>, he sinned<WH2398> yet more<WH3254>, and hardened<WH3513> his heart<WH3820>, he and his servants<WH5650>.

And the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547> was hardened<WH2388>, neither would he let the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>; as the LORD<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> by<WH3027> Moses<WH4872>. by Moses: Heb. by the hand of Moses
